1.content:
Dan walked into the street leading up to his house. Another day of crummy school over. Now he was 16, he didn't actually have to go to school. Well, technically. Of course his parents wouldn't let him quit. He'd come too far to give up now.

He wished he didn't have to go to school, like his sister Kat. It was her 18th birthday today. Dan didn't get her a present, of course. He never did. It wasn't like she ever got him one! But this morning, his parents didn't get on his back for it; because Kat had recieved a very big present from her parents. Dan had heard his mom say something about "all the girls in the family get this on their 18th birthday", and it being "something you have to keep secret". Dan had made a remark about it being a sowing quilt, and was consequently told off for it. But he had wondered what it was...

He went up to the front door, and rang the bell. Kat answered.

"Oh hello, fair brother, how was your day?" She said.

"Er... whatever. Dad said you couldn't start drinking until the party." Dan answered, rolling his eyes.

"Oh, I haven't been drinking", she said, grinning menacingly. "And I'm not going to the party, either."

"Dad paid $100 for that, you can't just 'not go' to your own birthday party!" Dan replied.

"He never did, that was just to keep me happy until I got my present. It was all a lie."

"It must have been a pretty darn good present if you're willing to give up your 18th birthday party for it!"

"Oh it was. And you, my pathetic little brother, will now experience it." She stood up, and picked up a small book, opening it at a marked page.

"What the heck..." Dan moved back towards the door. "If you do anything to me, mom and dad will kill you."

"Oh, I don't mind. In fact, I'm sure mom and dad wouldn't mind a new pet rabbit, or dog, or cat, or maybe a chicken for dinner or a pig for the barbeque."

"What, did they get you a pet store for your birthday?"

"You were just born an evil little kid, weren't you, Daniel? Well I think you'd make a far better animal."

"What?!" Kat raised a small wooden stick in her hand up into the air, and began reciting something from the book. When she was finished, the wand began to glow, and Dan began to feel slightly strange.

"Every female memeber in our family turns into a witch on their 18th birthday. Mom is more patient than me, she would never use her powers for wrong, but I'm not that kind."

Dan begans to feel very worried indeed....

The day for Dan passed in a slow fashion, dragging out and leaving Dan to depend more and more on his sow mind to pass the day...which troubled her because he could feel parts of his human mind simply drifting away, lost forever and replaced by the pig mind.

Evening came and with it a fresh bucket if slops, something Dan ate in a rather greedy and pig-like fashion. Afterward he retired to the inner pen, wondering if the farm girl would close the barn, trapping Dan inside, unable to meet the dog, who he recognised as Duke, at the appointed time.

Luckily, it was a warm summer evening and the farm girl, or any of her relations, didn't close the barn door, leaving it open to the cool night air could drift inward.

When Dan noticed the last light click off, he waited, wondering if this was some sort of trick. And then after a bit, he rose and casually strolling across the out pen, he peered through the laths and grunted out what she hoped, "Are you out there?"

Silence and Dan was almost ready to give out when suddenly a voice he recognised explained, "Ya,Ya wait a minute you little sow"

Elated, Dan sat down, staring toward the voice, wondering what it was he was to wait for. A moment passed and suddenly a cat appeared. Sitting down in front of the pen, the cat nodded toward a section of fencing and then said, "Press your weight against that part. And do hurry. We do not have all evening."

Confused, but wanting to get out, Dan walked toward the indicated section and pressing his body against the fence, she asked, "Who are you?"

As the section of fencing gave way, the cat sauntered over and looking Dan in the eye, it replied, "I was the farm girl’s brother. She cursed me into this tabby form because she wanted a pet. And then she lost interest when I wouldn't play with her."

"Quiet, the both of you," Duke's voiced barked out and both Dan and the cat turned toward the direction.

As Duke trotted toward them, Dan suddenly realised that he could once again talk in the human tongue and sensing the question, Duke cut her off with, "It is the first step in how we shall get revenge on those that hurt us."

The cat stood and strolling over to Duke, she sat down and asked, "And what is this plan?"

"Follow me," Duke replied and then standing, he turned and took off across the barnyard. Looking at the cat, Dan thought and then followed after Duke.

Across the barnyard the three tore, dodging from one shadow to another, sometimes hiding beneath objects. After what seemed forever, Duke finally led Dan and the cat into the woods, toward a glade. Plopping down, Duke looked at the others and then after Dan and the cat had finally been seated, he started to talk.

"Despite all appearances, Jen and Kat have made one mistake. When they turned me from Daisy to Duke, they only turned my sexual organs, not the rest of my body and mind."

Standing, Duke turned about and then finally lay back down on his back, exposing everything from his brisket down to between his legs. Peering closer, Dan could see the six teats, but was confused on all of this. Rolling over, Duke looked at the two and then continued.

"Something of their spell is causing me to revert back to being a bitch completely. Maybe it is a faulty spell or maybe the spell is doing what it is supposed to do. Either way, this has allowed an opening for me to act upon. Within a couple hours I will be completely female once again...something I am not really looking forward to....but what can you do?"

Unsure, Dan looked at the cat, who was cleaning herself, and the looking back at Duke, she listened as the dog continued.

"The one good thing about this is that for some reason I am able to manipulate some of their spells. Giving you back your human speech was one of them," he indicated toward Dan as he said this. "But my plan goes beyond that. I propose we assume human form once again, a spell I am sure I can pull off."

Unsure, Dan looked at the cat and then looking back at Duke, she and the cat asked as one, "What's the catch?"

Duke looked down and then after moment he explained, "In order for this to work we would have to become human females. The reason this is, is that the magick we seek to use against those who have hurt us, is only available to human females. I don't understand why I can do some of it, so please don't ask."

Looking at Duke and then the cat, Dan mulled over the options in her head. As she did so, the dog, who was now starting to sound more feminine, explained, "If you choose against this option, I won't be hurt. I understand why you might choose against something like this. And, I know where others are who might join me. Then again, if you decide to go along with it, it might be easier to persuade the others to join us."

Looking back toward the barn, Dan had no desire to go back, but she was torn about the decision of having to be a human girl. As she thought, she heard the cat start to purr and then after moment, she announced, "I'm in," and then turned to Dan, waiting for the sow's choice.

Dan woke up, a bit dizzy and worn out. But when he was human he had experienced more troublesome pains. He tried to open his eyes. Where was he again? What happened? As his eye lids opened a blurry morning sun awaited him. O yes, that’s right he remembered now. He readjusted his eyes to the light. His sister wasen’t that pleased when he refused his cooperation as a dog. Ha! How could she ever think he would work with the likes of her!

For some reason it was cold, but it didn’t seem to bother him. That crazy bitch wanted him to be a mother for some reason. Well, that wasen’t completely fair, he knew the reason. He had been a jerk to her all his life.

Dan could slowly see more and more things around him. He was a small animal that was certain, but where was he? He looked around, It was new and strange, yet somehow familiar. He lifted his head. Around him there was grass, a few tree’s and a large pond. He KNEW this pond, when he was little he had been playing her in the summer, catching frogs, trying to catch fish, or just a quick dive. If this was the pond that he thought it was then…

He turned his head to east. Yep there only 40 yards away was his house. He was in the large backyard of his parents. If he would ever get his hand on that sister of his then -. “Splash!”. Dan looked around, the sound had come from the pond. That’s right his sister had turned him into something else. Something much smaller then a dog. He took a step with his left foot, then his right. Damn I am really heavy, heavy and slow. He glanced at his left foot, or rather it was a strange green paw.

“O great, another freak-show” He started to fasten up his pace to the pond. There at the edge he sighed and took a deep breath, what was he going to see? He slowly stretched his head, and looked at his reflection in the water. Yep, he had already suspected it, a tortoise, a smooth stomp face greeted him. Not just any tortoise a Snap tortoise. He recognized the snap jaw from biology class.

He came a bit closer, he could see his shell. He wasent that big yet, probably and adolescent, His shell was about 13 inch wide, and 5 inches high. He moved another bit closer, was this really him?

And that was to close. Dan lost his new balance and slided head down into the cold pond. “Brff, Grggl” Dan instinctively was trying to breath in as much as he could. The feeling of cold water hitting him in the morning was as throwing a rock to his face. After a few dazed minutes his turtle body had adjusted to the temprature. His eyes slowly opened. He could see a greenish blurry light, he looked up. There was the sandy bottom of the pond. The BOTTOM of the pond? He wildly started to flip his paws. He had been laying upside down! He flipped and crawled, but he was only turning around in circles, This was harder then he thought, well he had only been a turtle for a few moments. Being unable to swim like one was not his fault.

He noticed he didn’t need air yet. Dan could probably go half an hour without air. Still it was looking really, really clumsy. After a few minutes he figured out how to turn around. With one swirl, down was down, and up was up again. Diving up from the water, Dan realized it was actually quite comfortable. He looked up to the sky. It was morning, remembering class, turtles were reptiles, not amphibians. He had to get out of the water! Dan looked around, he could see the edge of the pond, half crawling, and half swimming, the shore was reached!

With more luck and effort, then actual skill. He was able to crawl up the shore, back on solid ground. I know I don’t ever want to do that again! What was Kat thinking, Her only brother could have drowned in there. He took a few minutes to take take his breath. He would crawl to his mom and somehow convince her that he was her son. Then Dan felt strange, and fuzzy. The sun was gaining more power. He blinked his eyes, This here, being in the sun. It felt so incredibly good. He sprawled his arms and legs laid his head resting on the ground.

Mmmmm, He would get up in another minute, His mother would be convinced, His sister punished and “Yaaaawn” everything would be normal again. With this dream he doze off, having a nice vision of chasing frogs and mice.

Unaware of his sister watching him from a few “magically” looking bushes, She smiled, Maybe now her plan could work.

Dan ran off into the night hoping he could lose himself in the darkness, but the street lights gave a glow to everything. He could still see his paws and feel his tail and dog ears as well as all the parts that had changed. He ran on until he was so hot and panting feverishly to cool off that he could not go further. When he came upon people, he hoped that someone could help him; but as he got close, he would hear the same thing, "Loose dog. Call the catcher." If they didn't call out, Dan would go towards them pleading for someone to recognize him. Unfortunately, all they heard was barking which scared them. They would then call, "Mad dog. Call the catcher." This always frightened Dan, and he would take off again away from them even after one of them told the other, "It's too late tonight. Wait to see if he's loose tomorrow."

It was after one of these people chased after Dan and he went down an alley and between two houses that he saw an area ahead without any lights. He charged for it and soon found himself on the edge of a large park. He could smell the signs that people played here as well as smells of food - some fresh cooked and some decaying garbage. Both tempted him along with his desire to hide, so he trotted forward further away from any light. He saw little as it got darker and darker the further he went. With his nose and ears guiding him, he was now hunting like an animal. He was both glad he could and terrified that this is the way he might forever remain.

Shortly Dan caught a scent of something new, something different, and something that aroused his primal dog self even more. He did not know what it was, and it scared him, but it also drew him further on. He was still panting and his heart was again beating rapidly even though he was not exerting himself. It was anticipation of the unknown that had his adrenalin pumping and keeping him at high alert. However, the fragrance of trees without being tainted by city air soon filled him with relief. He hadn't realized it, but he had wandered far into the woods. Far beyond the hiking and walking trails. Far past where the sounds of the city could be heard. New sounds of the night, strange to Dan, were being made by the wind and creatures of darkness. So far that there was not even a faint odor of any human. He began to relax. He began to feel happy. This untouched forest began to feel like home.

Home. Dan's mind then thought of his home, his family, his sister. "Look what she has done!" he thought with anger and sadness. His family no longer thought of him as anything but a pet. His sister was using the situation to torture Dan in any way she could. He vowed again to get even as he also had this underlying thought that he should respect and obey her. But she wasn't here. No one was here. Just Dan. Alone.

How could his mom let this happen? Mom. Dan longed for his mother. She had always been there before to help him. Why did she not stand by him now? What power did Kat have over her? Had she cast some spell on his mother? No. NO, that cannot have happened. Dan felt even more depressed if his mother might be being tormented by Kat as well.

Dan suddenly felt he had to stop. He felt around sniffing for a spot. A spot he could collect his thoughts and he could rest. He just now noticed how tired he had gotten. Both his physical activity running away as well as the training plus his emotional wrestling of anger, happiness, sadness, fear, depression, and worry had taken everything out of him. Dan fell to the ground as he curled up. He felt like crying but that only made his eyes itch. Fortunately, he was so exhausted that sleep over took him as soon as his snout touched the ground.

~~~

The peacefulness of the forest, Dan's tortured mind, and his exhaustion quickly had him entering a deep sleep dream state. Jumbles of past events floated like snapshots regressing rapidly to before Kat has cursed him and to the things he'd done teasing his sister, but going even further back to the good times they'd shared when they were little before he had to prove himself to be better than she. Back then he had looked up to his sister for her help and friendship. She would make him snacks and a sandwich dinner when his parents worked late. When they played or walked to the park, they would always do what she wanted whether he liked it or not, but she had also gotten him out of trouble when he was little and had taken care of him, treating him like a little brother and almost like her pet.

Dan's mind began to see himself as a puppy. Kat took him out and feed him. She made him do tricks that he didn't like but she enjoyed him doing. She played with him, their favorite was Frisbee. She couldn't throw well to him, but he would chase it just like when he was a little boy, jumping to grab it as it sailed over his head. Dan felt the exhilaration of running fast as a dog, jumping and catching in his teeth. Dan's legs ran in his sleep as he trotted back to Kat with his prize waiting for her gratitude. He was happy when they were little.

He pictured himself holding the Frisbee for and looking up at Kat. She was holding a switch, barking words at him he didn't understand. He crouched and whimpered afraid of this new side of his sister, his master, until the sound of wind whistling past the moving switch woke him before he could feel its sting.
111111111111221222121121.title: A Night Alone.

1111111111112212221211212.content:
The sounds of the forest greeted day back to consciousness along with Dan leaving his dreams to scatter themselves before he could recall them. A light breeze was swishing through the bushes where he slept. It first seemed scary but became pleasant as Dan lay still enjoying the harmony of this place and the way he felt. Only his eyes felt itchy and burning. He tried to rub with his paws, but it was more of his wrists. For some reason, he licked his wrists and began to rub his eyes, and that made them feel better. He licked and rubbed again soothing them as they tingled and seemed warm for a short while until he finally opened them.

Dan had thought it was daylight from the sounds, but all he saw were pale shadows as if the moon's harsh glow kept the greens and browns of the forest in shades of gray. Even the sky looked a light gray instead of blue. However, the rays of light that hit him were very warm and not the coolness of the moon. He looked around even more and could tell it was definitely day, but he saw no colors.

"Am I going blind?" he thought. "Is this another effect of Kat's curse to make me loose my sight as well?"

Again he instinctively licked his wrist and rubbed his eyes while sitting up and pondering this until the obvious jumped forward in his mind. Dogs are color-blind. Rubbing his eyes after licking his wrists must have set off another change. Dan cursed himself for not anticipating this and avoiding it. He was now even more dog. What's worse, he was out in the wilderness enjoying the smells and sounds and sights. He was regressing to the instincts of a dog. Could loosing his entire human mental capabilities be just another change away? That scared him deep inside to be humiliated into living the life of a dog at his sister's beck and call.

"KAT!" Dan screamed in a long mournful howl. "KAT, I will not loose myself so you can be my master and treat me as a pet in front of my friends and family." His anger boiled over into sadness as Dan once more called for his mom to save him. His thoughts of her as well as Kat were very strong. He tried to think of humans he knew. No. He would think of other friends and family, not humans. He was human. He must remember. Dan closed his eyes and began to list every cousin, aunt, uncle, and all relatives. Next he took to reciting his friends and school mates and teachers. "Jen!" he cried when he thought back to what Kat had forced him to do to her. He became disgusted at what Miss Thromborne had done to him and then he to her, all for Kat's evil.

Dan knew that he must get back and save them as well as himself. He didn't know how, but staying here in the woods would not help, and possibly make him change further and permanently. Besides, he was hungry and thirsty. Back in the park there was a fountain and last night there were smells of eatable food, even if it meant pulling from a trash can like a dog. He had to keep his strength and think of a plan.

Letting his nose guide him again, Dan worked his way through the thick brush and woods until he came to the edge of a trail running through the trees. He could see it opening into the park, and his nose told him that someone had recently tossed a sausage biscuit somewhere not far away. His eyes made out a dark gray trash can sitting on the light gray grass beside the gray and black spotted trail. The fragrance of food was coming from that direction, so Dan decided to venture forward in hope that he could find something more than the wrapper that held the biscuit.

Suddenly as he stepped out, pounding footsteps grew louder approaching from behind. He darted back into the brush just in time to see a young woman jog by in a light gray outfit with a darker gray emblem and symbols on it. Dan was sure it was writing, but could not decipher the lettering. He knew he recognized those markings as letters and words but could not seem to fit them together as to what they said. It didn't concern him much at first until the thought that he may have lost his ability to read. Had he understood the words though, he may have been more concerned.

Once she passed, Dan crept quickly to the trash can finding the smell of the biscuit very strong. He stood up with his paws on the top and could see a gray and white wrapper sitting atop the overflowing pile of trash. He quickly reached with his teeth and caught hold of an edge pulling it off to the ground where it fell open revealing a half eaten biscuit and sausage. As his hunger had him chomp the whole thing in his mouth, he remembered his last encounter with trash acting like a dog. Now he was again stealing trash like one, but he knew what he was grabbing this time rather than just some canine instinct.

"There he is!" came a voice from across the park. Dan casually glanced over while he ate wondering what the man was shouting about. What he saw were two men and the woman jogger running towards him. As he chewed watching them, his mind finally interpreted the symbols and what words they formed: "Animal Control." It was the dog catchers!
1111111111112212221211212.title: The Hunters.

choices: Someone Waiting for Him at the Pound.
11111111111122122212112122.content:
Swallowing quickly, Dan turned back down the path to run away when he heard the woman's voice barely loud enough to understand, probably talking to the men. "Stop. You've spooked him. Go around the sides ... slowly." Then she whistled and called to Dan. "Here, boy. Nice doggy. Come see what I've got for you."

Dan froze on these words and looked back. Something made him want to obey her even though he knew he had to get away. "That voice." he thought. "A woman's voice. I need to listen to her." Dan's training would unfortunately soon be his undoing.

"I'll get him. Come here boy. COME! HEEL!" Dan heard one of the men shout. Looking at the man, Dan instinctively moved away from him. That voice was not a friendly one. It was male, and he shouldn't trust it.

"Here, doggy, doggy, doggy." a sweet voice filled his ears and mind. Dan turned around to the woman slowly approaching. He waited, watching her closely. "Nice, doggy. Sit. Sit." Her hand motioned him down, and Dan immediately behaved sitting as he was trained. He couldn't help himself. He had to. His mind was so conditioned. He wagged his tail as he sat and waited for her to come over and, hopefully, show her gratitude for his good behavior.

The woman came very slowly up to Dan handing him a doggy treat that he eagerly took and munched down. It tasted disgustingly dry like dirt and sawdust, but he wanted it just the same. His taste buds were still human but his hunger was pure dog. The curse kept reminding him in this way making him more and more miserable. As he chewed, she attached a leash to his collar then looked him over very carefully.

"He's too well behaved to be wild. He must have been lost by someone, but I see no tag on him. Let's get him back to the pound and we'll chip him and notify the owner."

With that she lead Dan towards a large van talking nicely to him. Dan was happy that she had found him and wanted her to take him and lead him, but he didn't know exactly why. He made friendly barking sounds pleading with her to help him get back to normal; but like all the others, she couldn't understand. Dan began to get that helpless feeling of how his sister had cursed him to be dragged around and humiliated by everyone. He even whimpered as he got depressed and they neared the truck.

Dan wondered what was going to happen now and what she meant by "chip him." What if he was so far away that neither Kat nor anyone could find him? Or if Kat didn't want to find him. Would his family even care if he disappeared. Mom sure would he hoped. Then he thought about what might happen if no one comes for him. "Don't they ..." and Dan gulped, "put animals 'to sleep' when their owners don't pick them up after a certain time."

He backed away as she opened the doors to the truck and pulled him over to get him in. He fought with all his strength fearing the worse of a needle and terminal sleep because they thought and saw him as a dog. He knew it useless since the two men would soon come over and just pick him up and toss him in, but he didn't know what else to do. He was terrified not knowing what would happen and looking at possibly a very short life as a dog. He didn't want to live his life as a dog, but he much less didn't want to die. He began to tremble as he held back from a ride to possibly the gallows.

"Easy boy. It's OK. No one is going to harm you. Come on. Up, boy, up." the woman's calm words coaxed Dan. "He's really scared of something." she spoke to the men. Then turning back to Dan, she crouched down to look Dan in the eyes and scratch behind his ears while speaking, "I won't let anyone hurt you. It's OK. There's nothing bad that will ever happen. Now come on and hop up." She patted the truck and Dan jumped in unable to control his actions from her gentleness and words as well as being a woman's command.

The doors shut. Dan was left in a sterile smelling, dark place that shortly stirred to life and rumbled off towards the unknown. He paced at first, but each bump and turn had him falling and sliding across the floor. Scared and alone again, Dan lay down in a corner to await his fate.
11111111111122122212112122.title: Into the Paddy Wagon.

111111111111221222121121221.content:
When the truck finally stopped moving, Dan was pretty well confused and shook-up from the ride. As the doors opened, he glanced up, and the bright light initially blinded him. He heard footsteps and something big came between the light and him.

"OK, mutt. We're here. Time for your shakedown." a man's gruff voice told him. "Come on. Get up!"

Dan saw a shadow move and felt something touch his upper thigh and a hand grabbed his collar. Then there was a painful sting where the thing touch him. Like an electric shock. The man dragged him to the door before Dan could even move his feet. He's dragged off the back of the van almost falling flat when he hit the ground. Fortunately, his feet were quick enough to get under him.

"Move it, mutt." and Dan felt a another stronger zap of electricity against his other hind leg. Dan tried to look but was pulled forward by the burly man, Dan's legs scurrying to keep up. Both his thighs quivering and almost unable to move with his legs. As they reached a large area that's fenced in with chain-link, the man pulled hard choking him as he threw Dan against the fence and pinned him there with his leg while he unlatched the gate. Using Dan's collar as a handle, the man lifted and sent Dan flying through the air into the back of the cage where he crashed against it.

Dan fell down hard and collapsed gasping from being choked. It felt as if the collar was trying to be removed, and his hips hurt from landing sideways on the cement floor. Slowly he stood up and turned to look at his rear. Placing his nose almost to his ass hole, Dan licked the spot that still stung from the electric shock and then his whole hip and thigh that was now tingling from the whole ordeal. The licking made them feel warm and good, and he continued until his thighs began to twitch and a sharp pain swirled around his hips.

He stopped and pulled back to watch as his hip and rear cheeks began to shrink and his muscles began to pull his thighs up so they rested almost parallel to his side. This changed his walk from that of a crouching human or monkey to that of a true quadruped with haunches.

As he watched the end of this happen, Dan screamed, "NOOooooooooooo." in another mournful howl realizing one of the last remaining vestiges of his humanity had now been lost. He again collapsed on the ground and began to whimper - the closet thing to crying he could do. He looked up and across at the man who had caused this. Short and in his dark uniform and cap that seemed to stick straight up from his head. Their eyes met and he could see a smirk on the man's face reminding him of someone evil.

The man turned away, and Dan closed his eyes putting his head down and thinking how Kat had caused this. Perhaps she was watching, maybe looking into a smoldering black pot of vile brew that worked like a TV for the evil witch she was. Her face came to him with a greenish color and dressed in a pointed black cape and hat like the Wicked Witch of the West in Oz, then seeming to morph into the man who'd dragged him in. He was becoming delirious with grief, self pity, and pain when he again called for help from his mother in an even worse mournful howl.

"QUIET, MUTT!" ZAP.

Dan was surprised by another shock that stung his side causing him to spring forward across the enclosure with a yelp.

"Why did you do that, Cathan  ? Your Irish temper?"

"The mutt deserved it." he spat as he strode off away from the cage.

The woman had returned and entered the large enclosure to put down bowls of water and some dry food. Dan cautiously approached them and sniffed, then lapped the water greedily while the woman stood back. After Dan had drunk and gobbled up the food, the woman moved in to stroke his head and scratch behind his ears while waving some device up and down his neck.

"That's strange. You've got no chip. How are we going to find who you belong too?" she posed to Dan rhetorically knowing he couldn't answer.

"Probably some nice young woman that he annoyed and left exasperated at his antics and now is distressed that he disappeared even after the gifts she gave him." Cathan retorted sarcastically still with a smirk that made Dan wonder why this person was so mean and feeling Dan knew him.

"No matter. We will wait and put the word out to other shelters in the area for when his owner comes looking. Until then, he is a guest here." the woman sternly replied as she left the enclosure and went out the door.

"A fine guest to be treated as a dog deserves for disobeying the rules and his master." Cathan muttered at Dan so no one else could hear. Then he quickly thrust through the fencing with his electric prod and just grazed Dan with a shock as Dan was moving away.

"I am watching you, mutt. Stay in line or ..." and the man buzzed the prod sadistically.
111111111111221222121121221.title: Life in the Big House.

1111111111112212221211212211.content:
The animal shelter became fairly busy shortly as people came through looking at the dogs and cats and other creatures along with the truck coming and going bringing in other dogs and an occasional cat. Dan kept watch for Cathan and made sure to keep to the middle of the enclosure and ready to move at any sign of the shock-stick coming his way. Unfortunately, one time he had taken a short nap allowing Cathan to sneak up on him and get Dan with a good jolt. There was something about that man that made Dan despise Kat even more but at the same time he wished he was back with her. At least then he would be back with his litter and pack.

"No. No. NO!" Dan quickly reprimanded himself. "Family. Family, FAMILY!" he was thinking more and more like a dog. Dan was scared. He was loosing the battle. He kept catching himself licking, especially where he shouldn't or didn't want to. He uneasily pranced around the enclosure and sniffed every breeze, person and animal that came near. He seemed to be more familiar with the animals than the humans, and that's what frightened him the most. Even more than Cathan's tormenting.

Dan smelled loneliness. He smelled happiness. He smelled and heard the whines of pain from injured animals that were brought in. He smelled new life as some animal had given birth. At one point, he smelled something terrible but could not place it until he heard one of the workers mention that the animal could not be saved. It was death. Death sent waves of terror through Dan, still not sure if that would be his fate if no one came for him or by Cathan's torture. But then Dan smelled something that made his stand up and get excited. It was a bitch in heat, and he could barely control himself as he ran around the enclosure wanting to get out.

"No. Stop. This isn't me." he told himself and sat down to forget, but his arousal couldn't be reduced that easy. He tried to stop himself as he sat, his head turning as he lifted one leg so his snout moved in. Dan jerked himself away with a howl. "STOOOOOOOOOOOOOOP!" and he ran to try to shake off this feeling. Unfortunately, all it did was make him pant, get tired, and breath harder, the bitch scent filling him even more. Soon he sat again, and shortly his nose was back down beneath him and his tongue reaching out. Dan tried but found the feeling stronger than the porn mags he used to get into the mood to masturbate. He thought of those pictures of scantily clad and naked women, and before he realized it, he was licking up a full boner and squirting himself and everywhere. It was too good to stop even when some went in his mouth and down his throat. When he could finally stop, he saw Cathan watching again with a smirk and then walk away with a happy gait. Dan felt sick having humiliated himself in front of Cathan, thinking he may never be able to control himself as a dog ever again.

~~~

As it began to grow dark, a truck came in with a young dog, barely more than a puppy, but big, bigger than Dan. He watched as the dog would frolic with the handler, fortunately not Cathan. It would get very excited and then stand up on a handler's leg and start humping, only to be dragged off and then try to hump something else. It must be at the age where it just matured but didn't understand its instincts and would go at anything. Dan thought it was funny as he watched until -ZAP- Cathan hit him solidly.

"All the cages are full. Why'd you bring in another? 'Cause you like his attention?" Cathan joked at the man as he went over to the man trying again to get the humper off his leg. Before the man could answer, Cathan told him, "Put him in with this one. He's been good and mellow. They should get along just fine. What's the name on the tag, anyway?"

"It says Stewart." the other replied.

"Well, Stewart," Cathan said with a poke and zap of his zapper to Stewart sending him springing high into the enclosure with Dan, "enjoy yourself with ole Danny boy here, and we'll see you in the morning."

With a loud clang, the gate was closed, and Dan watched as Cathan fastened a padlock and looked back at him with a mean smile before trudging off. Soon the lights went out, and the place began to get quiet, but the smells still filled the air as Dan and Stewart moved towards each other noses flaring as a precursor to the formal introduction.
1111111111112212221211212211.title: More Happenings at the Pound.

choices: Awake from a really bad dream.
11111111111122122212112122112.content:
As he sniffed his cellmate in the dark, Dan wondered why a dog would be called Stewart. He even wondered why anyone would be called Stewart. He remembered Stewart at school who is a year behind him. He was very good looking and athletic. All the girls were after him, even his sister, Kat. She had invited Stewart over several times where he and Dan had become quite good friends, sometimes pushing and wrestling, rolling around with each other. Kat was three years older but had taken Stewart on two dates, obviously intent on seducing him as she had done with several of the best looking guys in her class as well as Dan's. But she had come home early on the second and in a very foul mood not wanting to talk about it. Dan hadn't seen much of Stewart since though he called a few times to join him going somewhere, but Dan was always busy.

Dan continued his sniffing. Stewart smelled different. Of course, Dan didn't have that much experience smelling dogs, but Stewart didn't have that earthy, sweat, and poop scent that the other dogs did. He smelled -sniff- clean -sniff- like he just had a bath -sniff- with body wash -sniff- fragrance of -sniff- a field of -sniff- hay and -sniff sniff- fresh cut wood.

The scent of the bitch was drifting in the evening air again, and it mixed with Stewart's scent. It filled Dan's nostrils and flooded his mind setting off his male dog hormones. Without thinking, Dan's nasal investigation had taken him down Stewart's side and around to his rear hole. He had even dipped underneath in front of Stewart's rear legs and was now using his tongue to taste Stewart between his rear legs. To Doggy Dan it was pleasant and almost intoxicating.

"Hmmm? Friendly." Dan enjoyed the feeling he got of not being alone and having a companion. He pondered the flavor before he caught himself. "WHAT THE #@$% AM I DOING?" He backed away and tried to spit, but a slobber is the best he could do. "How much of a dog am I becoming that I just act automatically?"

Stewart had similarly moved around Dan, nose and tongue caressing many parts of Dan's doggy self. When Dan backed off, Stewart thought it a game and began a bit of pseudo-nipping and pushing trying to get Dan to play fight. Dan felt depressed but his torment only grew as he noticed his arousal from a combination of bitch and Stewart. Soon, though, reacting part by his continuing disgust and part wanting to have fun, Dan let his happiness wash away his disgust as they ran and rolled around together with friendly growls as if fighting.

Dan finally ran apart and caught the strong bitch scent again. He wandered up wind following the aroma of sexual invitation. His body became warm as blood rushed to his dogginess as it grew out of his sheath.

While Dan was lost in his growing desire, Stewart was following him, taking in Dan's scent and an occasional nip or lick. Dan was oblivious to Stewart as he roamed the enclosure in a haze of lust. The smell of heat also wafted into Stewart's snout, energizing the same reactions as Dan. However, Stewart did not pursue the source, instead just following Dan as they both grew hot.

Dan pressed himself into the corner of the enclosure where the bouquet was most intense. His ears were raised listening - for what he didn't know, but it seemed right. His tail began to slowly swish, and he raised it tall over his back. He wanted to squeeze through somehow but knew he couldn't. The frustration of this made him put his front paws up on the fence deliriously thinking maybe he could climb out. He tried to control himself, but found his human logic overwhelmed by dog instincts. In his scared boy mind he knew that he needed something to bring him back from this doggy state, and that's exactly what happened.

Just then Stewart climbed his back from behind and starting to hump him. Shocked, Dan tried to move but was trapped between the much bigger Stewart and the fence. He twisted and growled, but Stewart was persistent. More than persistent, Stewart crushed Dan into the fence. The wire pressing hard to his snout and face. Stewart returned Dan's warning growl with a ferocious, guttural deep growl that Dan knew meant he would not get away. Dan now realized that his recent actions were a sign to his cellmate that he was his bitch and Stewart wouldn't let him go.

Letting out a mournful howl, Dan's mental and physical state was now in excruciating pain. The sound drew forth the attention of something in the dark. From the corner of his eye, he saw a spot of light sending a beam swinging around the area until it fell on his and Stewart's activity.

"Well, well." a familiar voice came out of the dark from behind the spotlight. "I see you two have become very close friends. Pardon my intrusion while a I watch." and there was a devilish chuckle followed by several flashes of light. "Just some mementos."

Dan whimpered and remained immobilized by Stewart for what felt an eternity. He knew that somehow Kat had orchestrated all of this, and it all suddenly came clear to him. Kat had found out Stewart didn't want to be with her, but with him. She had probably turned Stewart into a dog as well and sent him here. She knew where Dan was all the time and was controlling his continued transformation and humiliation.

The light then disappeared, as if acknowledging Dan's revelation, and footsteps faded into the distance. Eventually, Stewart fell off and went across the yard and lay down. Dan just cowered in the corner shivering from what had happened and feeling completely abandoned and helpless to do anything.

"Am I really to be a dog forever?" Dan worried ready to cry if he could. "How and why would Mom let this happen? Will Kat really be my master, forever and ever tormenting me? Please Mom, don't leave me like this."

Dan was exhausted in mind and body. The only thing he could do was sleep and hope he would wake up from this terrible dream and find someone there to rescue him.
11111111111122122212112122112.title: Stewart's Surprise.

choices: Kat saves Dan for more breeding fun.
111111111111221222121121221121.content:
Dan awoke as the sky grew light. Crisp air filled his nostrils, but he felt cozy and wrapped in warmth. He took a big yawn and stretched out his legs. He could feel them touching something, something that also began to move. Lazily opening his eyes, he could see fur and remembered he was a dog. But the fur wasn't his. Then he remembered he wasn't alone. Beside and around him lay Stewart who was already awake using his tongue to bathe parts of Dan.

Springing to his feet, Dan stumbled across the enclosure trying to escape Stewart and memories of last night. Stewart slowly followed while Dan did his best to indicate he didn't want Stewart by him. Dan even tried to think like he did when "talking" to Kat, but Stewart didn't seem to understand. However, after a growl and a shake plus thinking "Just leave me alone," Stewart seemed to shrug and wandered off. Dan then went off to do his daily business followed by sitting down to clean himself with his tongue.

After some time of doggy cleaning, a thought hit him. "Disgusting. I'm doing stuff that is so revolting, but I don't even think about that like it's natural." Dan reprimanded himself, thinking he should wash his mouth out to get rid of the taste that just a few moments before didn't bother him.

Dan's fear of being a dog forever was growing stronger just as his dog actions were taking over more. All he could think about right now was having some juicy raw meat or some of those wonderful crunchy dry nuggets Kat had given him for dinner. "Oh, if only I had obeyed my master I wouldn't be here. ... Wait! NO! Kat's not my master. Not yet, anyway." Dan tried to keep his mind focused on who he was and not what he is. It was becoming increasingly difficult, and Dan got even more terrified which sent him into a fit running around the fence until he was panting hard and almost foaming at the mouth.

"Look at that one!" "What's wrong with him?" "Is he sick?" "He was wild in the park. Maybe bit by a rabid raccoon." Several voices were speaking, but Dan was too lost in his own mental torment to hear. He just sat in the middle of the enclosure staring out blindly until someone opened the cage and brought Dan and Stewart some fresh water.

~~~

About noon, the woman from yesterday came to the fence and told Dan and Stewart, "We got a call and someone is coming for Stewart shortly. Maybe we'll hear from your owner later."

Dan just looked at her with his doggy smile until she walked off. He was going to be stuck here longer, but at least he wouldn't have to worry about friendly Stewart. As if knowing what was said, Stewart came over and gave Danny a few licks goodbye just before his owner came. Dan tried to avoid them, but they just started sniffing each other and one thing lead to another before Dan came to his human sense and trotted away.

~~~

It was getting to be late afternoon while Dan snoozed when -ZAP- a jolt of electricity shot him in the side sending him flying straight up with a yelp then running across the cage.

"Great little toy this. I should get one for home." It was Kat showing her full evil smile.

"KAT! YOU BITCH, I'll ..."

"Speaking of bitches, where's your cell buddy?" she interrupted and then laughed.

"You ... you ..." Dan barked but was so mad he couldn't finish his thought.

"What did you say? Maybe you've finally reached the point so close to being a dog that I can no longer understand you. It should all be over tomorrow when the week's up.

"NO IT WON'T. I'll never ... What about tomorrow? What's with this week thing?" Dan kept barking as the woman who had caught him came over to Kat.

"He must really like you. I've never seen a dog bark so much when his owner came from him. You two must have some special bond."

"Yeah. It's like we're brother and sister." Kat smirked as the woman went to fetch Dan.

"Now, you know the state requires that all dogs have a chip and be neutered or spade unless they're used for breeding. You dog doesn't have a chip and still has his set, so you need to take care of that." the woman said.

"Oh, I've been taking care of that, alright; and he has been breeding." Kat said so innocently that Dan felt nauseous.

"That works as long as he is kept confined. But if he gets out and is picked up again, it's required that he be neutered."

"No, KAT. Don't ... you ... dare."
111111111111221222121121221121.title: Getting out.

choices: Kat stops for some play time.
Dan enjoys playing with some other old friends.
1111111111112212221211212211212.content:
"I'm not sure I want to, just yet. But if he does get out again, I guess, snip snip. Do they let you watch?" Kat told the woman as she glanced back at Dan.

"Oh, we can't do that here, but we have a list of vets that can. We can insert the chip here though, and it's cheaper than having a vet do it."

"Having a chip put in would be perfect. I'd like to watch that."

"OK." the woman said. "This way." and she lead Dan and Kat into the main building and down a couple halls to a small room with a large stainless table in the middle and various cupboards and equipment around.

"Just wait here, and I'll get Dr. Waltshire. You're lucky that this is his day to come by the shelter. Bye Kat. Bye Danny. I don't want to see you back here." she said as she scratched behind Dan's ears and left him feeling content and wagging enthusiastically.

"Well, I guess it doesn't matter if you run off again. Then I won't be responsible for the castration, you will." and this sent Kat into a fit of laughter. Dan, on the other hand, just sulked, thinking how he would possibly ever get out of this.

Soon the doctor came in and quickly lifted Dan onto the table before he knew what was happening.

"Do you want the regular chip or the new tracking one? It's more expensive but it can be traced using GPS so you can always find him if he gets away." The doctor told Kat.

"Normally, I wouldn't spare any expense for Danny here, but I don't think he will be wandering off again, and I can always find him easy enough." she said as she gave Danny a smirk and a wink acknowledging that he was right from last night that she knew where he was and made sure he was treated well, or well tormented that is. "Will this hurt him much?" she then asked with a big smile.

"A little bit, maybe." he said while pulling out something that looked like a big power drill or nail gun. "I've never had it done to me so I can't really say." he joked back to Kat who laughed hardily although it was probably at the fact it would hurt rather than the joke.

Dan began to shiver and squirm. He had no idea how much pain it may be, and didn't want a chip. He wasn't really a dog, and they don't do this to people, he thought.

"You need to keep him still now." The doctor told Kat, and she raised the electric prod and gave Dan the full force. With a short yelp, Dan was still, almost immobilized like a tazer would do.

"But some people have had these inserted, haven't they?" Kat then asked seemingly so innocent.

"Oh, yes. I think the military does it, and you can get one for yourself or kids at the military surplus store down ..."

"AWWWLLLLLL OOOOOOOOOOOO!" Dan howled as the doctor shot the chip into his shoulder or neck or somewhere around there that now hurt like hell's heat of a branding iron.

"HE SEEMS TO HAVE TAKEN THAT QUITE WELL." The doctor yelled over Dan's continuing screams. "HE SHOULD QUIET DOWN IN A FEW MINUTES, BUT IT WILL PROBABLY BE SORE AND HURT IF ANYONE TOUCHES IT FOR A DAY."

Dan could barely think let alone walk as Kat lead him to the car. Kat had noticed that the shock had made Dan loose control and wet the entire table. She managed to push Dan's nose into it and berate him as a bad dog while his nose got his own urine scent splashed into it. It made him sick and almost throw up. He couldn't get the feeling out of his head that urine smelled so good.

"Now, Danny. You will be a good doggy now, won't you? We don't want you running off and having to have you balls whacked off now do we?" Kat laughed and tossed Dan into the back seat of her car. She was still chuckling as she drove off down the road.
1111111111112212221211212211212.title: Chips Away.

choices: Another stop on the way home.
11111111111122122212112122112121.content:
On the way home, Dan's ears perked up at the sound of the wind rushing by and then his nose found the smells coming in the window. He climbed up and stuck his head out into the breeze. In no time, he pushed aside all his worries and loved having his nose pointed into the wind. Kat saw Dan acting like a true dog in the car and decided to stop to have Dan do more doggy stuff. She turned down a side road and pulled off along a big open field.

"Come on, Dan. Let's play with the Frisbee." Kat said as she opened the door and tossed the Frisbee into the field. Dan's dog instincts had him race out excitedly after the Frisbee. Kat knew Dan always loved to play Frisbee and took this opportunity to use that to lure him into enjoying being a dog and change his mind even more. Unfortunately, Kat was never very good at throwing, so each time it went lazily this way or that, or just into the ground. Dan, though, didn't mind as he ran and grabbed it off the ground just excited to run free after being caged for a day.

"Wow! This is so great. I haven't been able to run ... or had this much fun since .. since ..." Dan thought as he pounced on the Frisbee then trotted back with it panting and wagging his tail. Kat tossed it again before he could connect his thoughts. He was having such fun it didn't matter.

Shortly, a beat-up car pulled up, and a tall guy in old jeans and T-shirt got out and walked over to Kat.

"Nice dog there. Mind if I throw some?" Kat smiled and handed him the Frisbee. This time it was a longer throw that sailed and hung in the air. Dan put all his energy into a leap and caught it before it landed. Dan was in true happiness as he raced back so he could have this man give another real throw. He could see Kat talking to him each time he returned but was off again before he could hear anything.

Finally, the man made a really strong throw, and the Frisbee soared way across the field with Dan in hot pursuit. It went over his head and behind some tall bushes. It took Dan a while to find and grab it, so this time he raced back full speed with it. As he got closer, he didn't see Kat or the man initially and was concerned that Kat had left him to find his own way home. He didn't know how, and then remembered what was said at the pound: "...if he gets out and is picked up again, it's required that he be neutered." Dan shuddered at the thought and began to run harder and look for Kat.

Quickly his keen dog eyesight saw movement over by the man's car. Kat was with the man, but something didn't seem right. Then he recognized that the man had his arm around Kat and over her mouth while he dragged her closer to the car. Dan wasn't about to let some guy kidnap his master, so he exploded across the rest of the field.

"Master. Master." Dan barked until he realized what he was saying. "Kat, I'm coming." he corrected himself although his concern was more important than what he said or thought of her.

Dan reached them just in time before the man could get the car door open and force Kat inside. Instincts took over for Dan, dog instincts. He couldn't fight like a man anyway, so he jumped on him barking and knocked him to the ground. Dan then bit the arm holding Kat, but he hit Dan hard with the other and knocked Dan back cursing all the while. Dan attacked again and held his arm until the man let Kat go. The man pushed and kicked Dan loose and ran to the driver's door as Dan came back barking and was kicked away as the man got in and took off in the car. Dan ran after the car barking at its wheels until he heard Kat call him.

When Dan got back to Kat, she bent down to him rubbing his head and scratching behind his ears. Dan's tail wagged wildly as his panted with that happy dog smile enjoying the scratching, but he was gald that his master ... sister was alright.

"Good DOG, Dan. You're such a good DOG." Kat kept repeating heavily emphasizing the word "dog."

Dan felt really good. When Kat got up and quit scratching him, he barked his happiness and ran circles around her for joy. Kat just smiled and kept saying "Good DOG, Danny. Good DOG."

Kat let Dan back in the car, and they started home. So very tired from chasing the Frisbee and saving Kat, he just lay down in the back seat and closed his eyes.

"I saved her. I saved my owner." he thought. "I made her happy and she thanked me with petting and scratches. I am so lucky to have Kat as my master. ... Huh? I can't start thinking like that." But he was, more and more and more.

It wasn't until he almost drifted off to sleep that he remembered that Kat could do magic and wondered why she hadn't used it. "Maybe it was because her mouth was covered and couldn't say a spell?" he postulated. Then from the back of his mind came memories that he was Kat's sister, and he had doubts on all of this from playing Frisbee to fighting off the kidnapper. "Was this just something Kat planned?" Dan worried because it almost succeeded turning his mind 100% dog.
11111111111122122212112122112121.title: Carried Away.

choices: What goes bump in the night?
111111111111221222121121221121211.content:
When they arrived home, Dan was ready to play again, but Kat had other plans.

"Heel, Danny." she said, and Dan followed her to the back yard not even considering running or disobeying. She hooked him to the doghouse, scratched his head, and told him, "Be a good DOG and stay here. I will be back with your supper."

The emphasis of that word was having an effect on Dan, but he also realized what she was doing. "I can't let her succeed. Somehow I need to find a way to counter her spell." Dan sat and concentrated hard on everything he knew or had heard about magic oblivious that he began to clean himself. He was grateful that he still had those "human" memories which made him suddenly stop his licking in real disgust.

"I am loosing this with Kat." he whimpered and lay down depressed. "I look like a dog, and all my actions are changing. No one seems to be able to help. Mom didn't show she knew, and I tortured Jen." At that thought he almost cried.

"Movies and web sites of magic, all usually had some special charm or object that allowed the person to do magic. Of course, those were fictional since magic doesn't really exist. Right !" His thoughts drifted towards anger and some good old witch burning. He pictured Kat in a black dress and pointed hat lead away as he followed, barking at her captors and rescuing her.

"NO! WAIT! STOP! I'm the one to carry the torch and set her ablaze." he screamed in his head as he opened his eyes, stood up and shook himself - just like a dog.

"Dinner time, DOGGY." came Kat's voice as she walked from the house. "Here's a special treat for you for being such a good DOG and protecting me."

Dan could smell something really good and surely tasty. He barked and wagged his tail in anticipation.

"Down, DOGGY. Sit." Kat commanded, and Dan paused but then obeyed. "OK, now speak for your food."

"What should I say?" Dan thought and sat there. "How degrading it is to have to do tricks to get fed. Not going to happen."

"If you're hungry you better say, "Yes master. Please feed me." Good DOGgies speak for their food, or ... yes. Let's see you beg."

"Beg? Don't be ridiculous. Why should I ... ?" Just then Dan sat up on his haunches and raised his front paws as Kat held the bowl above him.

"Good DOG. Now speak. Speak."

Dan tried not to, but he couldn't stop himself. "Woof. Woof."

"Good DOG. Here's your surprise." Kat leaned over to set the bowl down. That's when Dan noticed something swinging from her neck. Something shiny. But his nose and tummy quickly had him ignore that as he jumped to the food sniffing and eying it. The smell said "Delicious." to his dog side. He took a nibble. The taste was actually really good. He was so hungry from the day, he wolfed it down then took quite a few laps from the water bowl before looking back up at Kat and wagging his tail.

"Was that good?" she asked but Dan wouldn't speak until she said enthusiastically, "Did DOGGY like his meal." Dan barked and wagged unable to stop himself.

"OK, then. Give me a shake." and Kat held out her hand.

"Do you really think I'm going to do tricks for ..." he thought as he raised his paw, and she shook it.

"Now be a good DOGGY and lie down." Dan lay down and looked up at her with shiny eyes.

"Roll over. Come on, DOGGY. Roll over." she directed and waved her hand a round in a circle. Dan held out as long as he could but soon lost control and rolled over, not once but twice.

"Good DOGGY. Here's another treat." Kat held out something in her hand and Dan took it quickly. With a couple crunches, it was swallowed. Kat gave Dan a hug around his neck. "Now let's go for a walk before bedtime."

Dan felt so demeaned that he almost just lay there instead of going for a walk. Sadness filled him as there seemed little hope except being a dog the rest of his life.

As they headed down the street, Dan sniffed all along unless Kat pulled his leash tight or called, "Heel.". Then he quickly went back to her, but was soon ahead again extending the leash.

A couple doors down, a cat ran across in front of them, and Dan barked, "Hey, Cat. Don't cross me. Get to your house or I'll eat you." The cat stopped at the house's front door, looked once at Dan then just preened ignoring him as Dan woofed, "Good thing I'm on a leash, or I'd get you."

Kat just chuckled. "Yeah, you'll be a hundred percent by tomorrow. Next day, latest." She controlled Dan around the block and back home only to tie his leash to the dog house. Dan turned and panted looking at her almost whimpering at his inability to resist.

"OK, Danny. Sit."

Dan immediately obeyed and stared at Kat with that silly, happy, panting smiley face that dogs do. He watched Kat just stand there for a while then lean forward and say, "You've been a good DOG. So I'll see if you can spend the night inside. Would you like that, DOGGY?"

Dan wasn't really paying good attention. His eyes were looking at that shiny something hanging way down from Kat's neck on a little string. He didn't remember her ever wearing that.

"Well, speak if you want to come inside." Kat insisted when Dan hadn't barked.

"Please, I want in." Dan eagerly barked.

When Kat was gone, he thought "Good. Now I can quit pretending to be almost a dog. It's repulsive, but I have to keep her fooled." although it was almost no pretending any more.

"What was that around her neck. A medallion or something. I wonder if that's how she gets her powers. She didn't wear it before her birthday."

It was a while later when Kat came and took Dan off the leash. "Now, you must be good and do just like I say or you'll be back out here with the snap of my fingers. So shake on it." Dan had little choice no matter how degrading, but he knew this wasn't doing a trick. He lifted his paw, and they shook. After that, Kat opened the door and took him inside.

Kat lead Dan up to her room and told him he could sleep at the foot of her bed on the little rug. "And don't try running off in the night. There's a little surprise spell if you do." she smirked as she went to the bathroom to get ready for bed. When she came back, Dan was sitting on the rug and could see the medallion clearly due to her low-cut nightie.

"Be a good DOG, and you can stay with me without any more worries. No school, no clothes, no chores. Just a happy DOGGY." Kat said as she bent down and petted Dan. The thing on the string swung forward and almost hit Dan on the nose. He saw its strange markings and symbols and was now sure that's where Kat's power really was.

Kat hit the lights and dove under the covers. Dan was sure he heard her laugh, but he was focusing on the medallion. Dan turned a couple circles and lay down. He knew he must at least try to get it. So he came up with a plan as his put his head to the floor and closed his eyes for the night, dreaming and scheming.
111111111111221222121121221121211.title: Tricks and Magic Source.

1111111111112212221211212211212112.content:
As Dan drifted off, his ears and nose took in all the sounds and scents of being in Kat's room. Through the open window, the night sounds blew in with the crisp autumn air. Distant cars rolled on, a far-off cat screeched, a neighbor's wind chime tinkled an occasional note. Cool and fresh, the slight intermittent breeze brought the smell of dried leaves and cut hay from the nearby fields. It mixed with the sweet feminine fragrances of Kat's room to create an intoxicating aroma. As if a smoky potion, it put Dan into a vivid dream state.

His mind wandered through the happiness of freedom. Free of responsibilities, free of time and deadlines, free of homework and school, free to play or sleep as he desired. His only need was the affection of his owner, and of course food and water. A fantasy for sure, but one that was within his reach. He could see it on the horizon, a shining backdrop, an almost brilliant future. He moved faster to get there - trotting, loping, rushing, flying. But then rising against that bright background and casting a shadow, something beckoned him into its cool darkness, it waited for him to accept it, it closed around him like a cold, harsh trap ensnaring his life and soul, locking out all others.

He now felt alone, depressed, scared. The monolith creating the shadow pulled his life force for its own entertainment, humiliating him, leaving him in despair. His only salvation: renounce all he had been before, free himself from that burden, and ignore his previous desires, needs, life, and future. Allow himself to become without purpose in a new form. A vestige of his former self, surviving with only one focus - his master.

The looming monolith was the figure of his sister, Kat. Like a small kitten that he played with that had become a cub that he teased and was now a lioness, a sabortooth, a feline demon seeking revenge. Holding the threads of his future like a marionette, she plucked at them with her claws and made Danny dance as they frayed and became too weak to hold him from a fall into the dark evil she exuded.

Dan whimpered in his sleep trying to escape his dream's fate. Only a speck of light was left of that gleaming future Dan had initially chased. He struggled towards the speck, and slowly it grew bigger. Exhausted and tormented with each step, he continued though doubting he could make it, crying at the repeated embarrassments he was forced to endure, his legs weary, eyes barely able to focus on that one shiny spot hanging from his sister's neck.

Kat's room began to glow with the morning light. As he opened his eyes, Dan found he was no longer curled on the rug on the floor. He was on the soft comforter that covered Kat's bed and her. Actually he was curled up against her. As he moved, so did Kat. He became paralyzed with fear knowing that she had told him to sleep on the floor. His punishment for moving was sure to be quick and harsh, unless ... could he quietly and gently get off before she fully awoke and found him.

He finished his stretch and yawn then started to move, but it was too late. Kat was reaching out from the comforter and her eyes fell upon him.

"Danny." she called out and threw her arms around him. His instinct was to fight and run, but there was nowhere to go with the door shut. Fear prodded him to think maybe out the window if he could penetrate the screen. A fall from the second floor may be preferable to her arms becoming an anaconda around his neck. He could bite his way loose but that would probably make his torture worse. So he lay still and waited, reluctantly accepting his fate.

"Danny, Danny, Danny." came Kat's enthusiastic greeting as she rubbed his head and scratched behind his ears. "You do want to be my dog and hang by my side." Then she hugged him and kissed his head.

This tormenting was even more cruel than the physical abuse she had inflicted. He still had no desire to be a dog let alone HER dog. But his dog mind was growing ever stronger, cherishing her treatment, filling his body with joy, making his tail wag, his eyes shine, and his tongue pant and lick his sister in the face (the latter actually giving Dan more comfort knowing she hated it as she let go to wipe it off, then ran for the bathroom to wash her face).

Unfortunately, this left Dan trapped in her room after a whole night that had filled his bladder. He needed to get out and go, or go and get out. The sound of the shower only made this worse, and he knew Kat would be quite some time as her showers often would drain the hot water heater - all 60 gallons. But the worst sensation he felt was that it wasn't just a number one full tank. He had to drop ballast as well.

Dan paced for awhile but that extended pressure on each step and turn. He whimpered and was going to bark, but knew he'd be punished and banned to the back yard if he woke the family. He thought about crossing his legs, but trying that as a dog just squashed his belly making it more painful. Finally he lay down spreading his back legs to keep his belly and weight off the floor. If he avoided thinking of his situation, he might make it, but only if Kat hurried.

Today fortune was on his side. Kat had an early appointment, did a quick shower, and dried herself and hair in all less than twenty minutes. However, it felt like hours to Dan. When Kat entered, he jumped to the door, but she slammed it shut. "No trying to escape. You wouldn't like the penalty." she cautioned him. Dan just ran in a circle then went and scratched on the door and whimpered. "What's the matter with you? Have you gone crazy?"

Dan groaned, "Let me out. I gotta go. Hurry, please!"

"You're not going anywhere. I thought you liked your stay here. This isn't the way to show it."

He was about to bark but again knew he might wake the household and probably not get him out any sooner. Then it struck him. He knew what he had to do to get through to Kat. It would be disgusting, but what choice did he have.

Dan pleaded again, "Gotta go. Gotta go." Next he sat and baring the thought from his mind of what he was doing, he licked himself, first on his sheath over and over, then whined and scratched the door again. When Kat still stood dressing and ignoring him, he turned his body in a 360, whimpered and ... liked his ass, looked at Kat to make sure she saw, then licked it again.

"Oh, you want to clean yourself." Kat laughed to Dan as she pulled on her jeans. "Bet you started feeling that just after I went to shower, huh?" and she winked at him motioning like a spell with her hand.

"She knew all along and was teasing and tormenting me!" Dan realized going over and scratching the door repeatedly with both paws.

"Don't mar that door or I'll make it so you can't release even once you're out."

That was enough to freeze Dan where he stood.

"Good DOG. Now let's get you out while I finish getting ready.”
1111111111112212221211212211212112.title: Dreaming up a load.

11111111111122122212112122112121121.content:
Dan bounded down the stairs heading for the back door driven by his desperate need to get outside. He found it amazing how he had adapted to his dog form that was almost 100% physical now. It was so easy to do anything without thinking, and running was becoming fun. His new dog senses of smell and hearing were pretty cool as he could clearly hear whispers and knew what was going on as well as find smelly goodies. The only disappointment was that he could no longer see colors, only black, white and shades of gray.

As he flew into the kitchen, he hit the shiny floor like a rocket on skates and slid across the floor unable to slow or stop with his paws and nails.

THWHAMP!

Dan hit the back door head-on just able to turn a bit sideways so it was the side of his head and not his snout. Kat heard the noise just before she entered and saw Dan on the floor dazed and confused. She broke out laughing so hard she could barely stand. Dan was groggy enough that he instantly felt happy that he had made his master feel so good. He got up and staggered around with his nails getting little traction as he tried to run to her barking for joy.

"Quiet, Dan" she giggled until she also slid on the floor and noticed that there was a little yellow puddle where Dan had fallen. The excitement and crash must have caused him to squirt a bit. Needless to say, Kat was no longer amused.

"Damnit, Dan. I thought you were housebroken." she exclaimed as she grabbed his collar and pushed his nose into the puddle. "Bad, DOG. Bad!." she said sternly and spanked his rear with her other hand. "Looks like you're gonna have to wait for your food until I get back at noon." Then she opened the door and tossed him out.

Dan felt bad that Kat had punished him. It wasn't his fault, really. He wanted to say he was sorry and started to bark at the back door until he finally regained some of his human senses.

"That bitch. She's almost got me. I gotta be careful." he thought. "Whatever hurts me pleases her and then she finds excuses to inflict more pain." He was upset, concerned, and scared that he was getting closer and closer to being like this forever. However, Dan didn't dwell on that because he really had to go. He leapt off the porch and headed to the closest bush running right up to several wires stretched around it on short poles so he couldn't get near.

"And don't think you're going to pee on the bushes and kill them. You need to be trained in the garden as well." Kat yelled at him as she closed the door with a smirk on her face. "That should keep him in discomfort for a while longer." she thought.

Dan ran to the next tree, then another bush panicking because he was about to explode but they all were surrounded by the wires. His nose hit one of the wires and ZAP!, it was just like Miss Thromborne's shock harness only this time it was his nose. Dan finally decided just to turn and lift his leg on the fence. He just couldn't hold out any longer. Unfortunately, hitting an electric wire with salty liquid was not the smartest move.

BZZZZZZZZAPPP!

"YOWL!" Dan howled as he actually flipped over sideways and rolled further into the yard. The shock made him unable to control himself as if he had been tazed. When he eventually landed on his back, he was shooting a geyser out across the yard while he stayed paralyzed and trembled.

Kat had watched out the back window and was enjoying every second of Dan's misadventure. She was bent over in laughter and would have stayed to watch him wallow and whimper in pain as his nerves recovered from the electric pulse, but she had to make her appointment. She was in the best mood she had been all week.

"I'm gonna have me a full time doggy." she smiled then began to sing as she headed to her car, "How dumb is my brother in the garden. The boy with the waggley tail. ..."

Dan was finally able to right himself from this indignity, and stumbled forward through the yard until he sniffed a spot that would be perfect for his poop. He spread his legs a bit, lifted his tail and relaxed. Nothing. He pushed a bit. Nothing. He groaned as the pain of its pressure in his behind built even though nothing came out. Dan started prancing and hopping in hopes of breaking it loose. He was sure Kat had used a spell to stop his release. It wasn't like he had eaten a lot of vegetables or roughage like his mom had always told him at the dinner table, but he didn't think that should matter for a dog. Maybe his ass was still human. The concept that all that was left of the teenage boy was his mind and his ass was too subtle of humor for Dan to recognize. Besides he needed to get the crap out. It was just more painful torture by Kat.

Eventually, Dan was able to relax and get relief. The exertion by then was so much that he curled up by the dog house and didn't even think to wander around to see if he could escape. It wasn't like there was anywhere to go at this point.

"That must be the stupidest dog." came a voice from his neighbor's yard. Dan looked up and hanging over the side fence having watched the whole thing was ...
11111111111122122212112122112121121.title: On the way to relief

choices: He's hauled to the pound for too much barking.
111111111111221222121121221121211212.content:
Dan instantly recognized the sound of that voice although he did not catch all the words except the last: "dog." At this his ears perked up and he swung his head round to see Gus Haltfort leaning over the fence with an unbelieving grin and shaking his old, gray head. Gus was one of his oldest friends (literally, being in his seventies) having lived next door his entire life. He was always the most insightful and understanding person. Dan had often talked to him about difficult situations, and Gus always had sound advice that Dan mostly adhered to, or wished he had.

"Maybe Gus can help if I can communicate to him." Dan thought and immediately barked, "Help, me." as he ran to the fence and then turned a circle in front of Gus.

"At least you're friendly." Gus said, but Dan could only make out the word “friendly.”

"Of course, I'm friendly. It's me, Gus, Danny." Dan yipped and whined and barked, putting his paws up on the fence and instinctively licking at Gus's face and hands.

"Easy, boy. You act like we've known each other forever."

Recognizing only “known forever" Dan continued. “We have.” Then thinking quickly, he pawed at his collar turning his head and forcing his neck towards Gus so he could see the tag.

"Calm down. What's the matter?" Gus asked trying to keep any more slobber off him. As Dan again pawed his collar, Gus finally reached over and looked. "I can't take it off. There's no clasp. ... Hey! Kat's named you after her brother." Gus laughed as he added, "I'm not sure if that's her opinion of you or him! Maybe both."

Dan pulled down on all fours then growled at the word: "Kat." He was having real problems understanding most of Gus's words, but barked again, "I am Dan. She's a witch and changed me to a dog." Dan kept trying to scratch the collar and making his howls and whimpers sound like words.

Gus watched perplexed at Dan's antics. "That's a crazy dog trying to do something." Gus thought as he raised his cap from his bald head and scratched it.

Dan barked as he sat and nodded his head, then raised his paw as if to shake.

Gus's expression went to complete shock at this. "You're a real strange one, that's of sure." he said staring at Dan.

It was now his big chance as he had Gus's attention. Dan knew he just needed to get Gus to recognize him and to convince him that Kat was a witch. “But how?” He just wished he could understand more words. “Why can't I?” Dan thought. “Unless … I'm getting so much a dog I can't.” and that sent panic through him knowing that would be the final transformation.

With renewed urgency and hope, Dan looked around and saw the Frisbee he and Gus would toss at each other over the fence while they talked about things. Dan ran and grabbed it then went to the fence and tried to toss it over. Unfortunately, it barely fell from his mouth as his long panting tongue rolled over it and kept it from flying.

"Chase the Frisbee, boy?" Gus asked as he moved down the fence. "Hand it over." and he reached out for it.

Dan didn't want to "hand" it to him, but throw it. Gus looked very surprised at the dog "throwing" the Frisbee, and went to pick it up. When he got ready to throw and saw the dog in Dan's usual spot standing on his hind legs (as best as Dan could manage with dog legs), he stopped and again scratched his head before throwing it to Dan.

"You're acting just like Dan."

Dan caught the Frisbee and tossed it back, then barked at Gus's statement. "I am Dan. I am!" Next he tried to do a typical Dan action running to his "spot" by the fence and sitting on the ground as he did when Gus would talk leaning on the fence.

Gus remained confused, but eventually inquired with his face and the words, "Are you really Dan?"

"No. Wait. That's not possible. You just know the word "Dan" is all."

Dan went back down and growled at this statement. He was so close. All he had to do was explain Kat's involvement. He tried to bark or whimper to sound like he was saying Kat, but it all ended up like a howl, "OooohooOOOooOH ooooo."

"That's a scary sound. Like some spooky spell or creature." Gus puzzled at Dan.

"So, something spooky happened ... turned you to a dog ... when you took a crap?"

So Dan tried the only thing he could think of, he forced a meow. Of course it came out a hideous sound like he had been hit in the balls, and it caused Gus to back away from the fence.
